dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A

dialogue_turns.text: Oh, totally. And not even in a good way! It was all about, like, fostering mistrust in closed societies and preserving outdated customs that, frankly, just harm young girls and women.

dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: If you want relevant and stirring real-life lessons on ... winning the trust of people in tradition-bound societies to change age-old customs that hurt young girls or hold back women, youll be spellbound by this conversation with Melinda Gates.

dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! And remember her book? "The Moment of Descent." It apparently, uh, didn't do so well.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! And remember her book? The Moment of Descent. It apparently, uh, didn't do so well.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: I spoke with her earlier this year at The Executives Club of Chicago on the occasion of the publication of her bestselling book, The Moment of Lift: How Empowering Women Changes the World.
